description: Primes p for which the period of reciprocal = (p-1)/5.
comments: Cyclic numbers of the fifth degree (or fifth order): the reciprocals of these numbers belong to one of five different cycles. Each cycle has the (number minus 1)/5 digits.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
Index entries for sequences related to decimal expansion of 1/n
mathematica: f[n_Integer] := Block[{ds = Divisors[n - 1]}, (n - 1)/Take[ ds, Position[ PowerMod[ 10, ds, n], 1] [[1, 1]]] [[ -1]]]; Select[ Prime[ Range[4, 2000]], f[ # ] == 5 &]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 02 2000
extensions: Entry revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 30 2007
